item.title: Trump's Budget Plan Proposes Cuts To Great Lakes Restoration Projects
item.description: July 10, 2017 - President Trump's 2018 budget plan eliminates millions for Great Lakes restoration. What does that mean for projects across the Great Lakes, including research on harmful algae and Asian carp prevention efforts? NPR looks at the most important programs in each lake that could be targeted.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 10, 2017 - President Trump's 2018 budget plan eliminates millions for Great Lakes restoration. item.title: Pain Before Pleasure Makes The Pleasure Even Better, Study Finds
item.description:
July 10, 2017 - A study from the University of Kentucky shows that doing something virtuous can make indulging later even more pleasurable.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/07/10/536392970/pain-before-pleasure-makes-the-pleasure-even-better-study-finds
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 10, 2017 - A study from the University of Kentucky shows that doing something virtuous can make indulging later even more pleasurable. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/10/536392970/pain-before-pleasure-makes-the-pleasure-even-better-study-finds

item.title: Dads Respond Differently To Daughters Than To Sons, Study Finds
item.description: July 10, 2017 - Researchers from Emory University, using functional MRIs to measure fathers' brains, found that they had different biological reactions to their daughters' faces than to their sons'.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 10, 2017 - Researchers from Emory University, using functional MRIs to measure fathers' brains, found that they had different biological reactions to their daughters' faces than to their sons'. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/10/536392871/dads-respond-differently-to-daughters-than-to-sons-study-finds

item.title: NASA Spacecraft Gets Up Close With Jupiter's Great Red Spot
item.description: July 10, 2017 - NASA's Juno spacecraft will fly directly over the Great Red Spot, a swirling storm on Jupiter, on Monday. Scientists are hoping to gain a better understanding of the storm and why it persists.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 10, 2017 - NASA's Juno spacecraft will fly directly over the Great Red Spot, a swirling storm on Jupiter, on Monday. Scientists are hoping to gain a better understanding of the storm and why it persists. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/10/535977281/nasa-spacecraft-gets-up-close-with-jupiters-great-red-spot

item.title: Women With High-Risk Pregnancies Are More Likely To Develop Heart Disease
item.description: July 10, 2017 - Women who develop diabetes or high blood pressure during pregnancy, or whose babies are born prematurely, often are unaware of their own increased risk of heart disease later. So are their doctors.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 10, 2017 - Women who develop diabetes or high blood pressure during pregnancy, or whose babies are born prematurely, often are unaware of their own increased risk of heart disease later. So are their doctors. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/10/535644276/women-with-high-risk-pregnancies-are-more-likely-to-develop-heart-disease

item.title: The Call-In: Physician-Assisted Dying
item.description: July 9, 2017 - It's been a year since California passed its right-to-die law. JoNel Aleccia of Kaiser Health News discusses the change and Lisa Crawford talks about her family's experience.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 9, 2017 - It's been a year since California passed its right-to-die law. JoNel Aleccia of Kaiser Health News discusses the change and Lisa Crawford talks about her family's experience. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/09/536263078/the-call-in-physician-assisted-dying

item.title: Young Black Girls Face 'Adultification'
item.description: July 9, 2017 - A new study shows that black girls are viewed as less innocent and in need of less protection than white girls. A Martinez speaks to two authors of the study: Rebecca Epstein and Dr. Jamilia Blake.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 9, 2017 - A new study shows that black girls are viewed as less innocent and in need of less protection than white girls. A Martinez speaks to two authors of the study: Rebecca Epstein and Dr. Jamilia Blake. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/09/536263057/young-black-girls-face-adultification

item.title: While Corals Die Along The Great Barrier Reef, Humans Struggle To Adjust
item.description: July 9, 2017 - It's the world's biggest coral reef system, home to some 400 types of coral. In the past 18 months, rising ocean temperatures helped cause the single greatest loss of coral ever recorded there.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 9, 2017 - It's the world's biggest coral reef system, home to some 400 types of coral. In the past 18 months, rising ocean temperatures helped cause the single greatest loss of coral ever recorded there. http://www.npr.org/sections/parallels/2017/07/09/535754962/while-corals-die-along-the-great-barrier-reef-humans-struggle-to-adjust

item.title: 'G19' Nations Affirm Climate Plan, Acknowledging U.S. Withdrawal
item.description: July 8, 2017 - Noting President Trump's stance, a declaration states, "The leaders of the other G20 members state that the Paris Agreement is irreversible."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 8, 2017 - Noting President Trump's stance, a declaration states, "The leaders of the other G20 members state that the Paris Agreement is irreversible." http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/08/536169691/g19-nations-affirm-climate-plan-acknowledging-u-s-withdrawal

item.title: Biologists Divided Over How To Save Endangered Pangolin
item.description: July 8, 2017 - The pangolin is a small armadillo-like creature. It's in great demand for its meat and scales, and it's in danger of extinction. Biologists can't agree on whether zoos should play a role in saving it.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 8, 2017 - The pangolin is a small armadillo-like creature. It's in great demand for its meat and scales, and it's in danger of extinction. Biologists can't agree on whether zoos should play a role in saving it. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/08/536125055/biologists-divided-over-how-to-save-endangered-pangolin

item.title: Florida Swaps Out Septic Tanks For Sewers To Fight Coastal Pollution
item.description: July 7, 2017 - Septic tanks, long considered safe and effective, are increasingly seen as a major contributor to coastal pollution. Florida is now starting the costly job of switching hundreds of thousands of homeowners from septic to sewer.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 7, 2017 - Septic tanks, long considered safe and effective, are increasingly seen as a major contributor to coastal pollution. Florida is now starting the costly job of switching hundreds of thousands of homeowners from septic to sewer. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/07/536025773/florida-swaps-out-septic-tanks-for-sewers-to-fight-coastal-pollution

item.title: Who Gets To Fish For Red Snapper In The Gulf? It's All Politics
item.description: July 7, 2017 - The fish were nearly wiped out from the Gulf 20 or 30 years ago, so the catch is closely regulated. A Trump administration deal to extend the recreational season has prompted cheers – and concerns.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 7, 2017 - The fish were nearly wiped out from the Gulf 20 or 30 years ago, so the catch is closely regulated. A Trump administration deal to extend the recreational season has prompted cheers – and concerns. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/07/07/535021139/who-gets-to-fish-for-red-snapper-in-the-gulf-its-all-politics

item.title: Georgia OB-GYN Will Lead Centers For Disease Control And Prevention
item.description: July 7, 2017 - Dr. Brenda Fitzgerald, who leads the Georgia Department of Public Health, has been appointed CDC director. She'll take over as the Trump administration seeks big cuts to the CDC's budget.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 7, 2017 - Dr. Brenda Fitzgerald, who leads the Georgia Department of Public Health, has been appointed CDC director. She'll take over as the Trump administration seeks big cuts to the CDC's budget. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/07/535954163/georgia-ob-gyn-will-lead-centers-for-disease-control-and-prevention

item.title: To Prepare For Mars Settlement, Simulated Missions Explore Utah's Desert
item.description: July 6, 2017 - NASA plans to send people to the Red Planet in the 2030s. In the meantime, a remote location in southern Utah serves as a non-NASA training ground for the Mars-minded.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 6, 2017 - NASA plans to send people to the Red Planet in the 2030s. In the meantime, a remote location in southern Utah serves as a non-NASA training ground for the Mars-minded. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/06/522060920/to-prepare-for-mars-settlement-simulated-missions-explore-utahs-desert

item.title: Montana Earthquake Is Felt For Hundreds Of Miles Early Thursday
item.description: July 6, 2017 - The earthquake was the strongest to hit western Montana in years; it was followed by at least 10 measurable temblors with magnitudes of up to 4.9.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 6, 2017 - The earthquake was the strongest to hit western Montana in years; it was followed by at least 10 measurable temblors with magnitudes of up to 4.9. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/06/535741701/montana-earthquake-is-felt-for-hundreds-of-miles-early-thursday
